CreditLine: Gift of Mr. Max Falk in honor of former Director and Medieval Art Curator, Richard H. Randall, 1991
Description: On the left panel of this superb devotional ivory, St. George, in medieval armor, raises his lance and shield in triumph.  An angel lifts his helmet from his head, as the rescued princess leads away the defeated dragon.  The right panel shows the Virgin and Child between Saints John the Baptist and Catherine of Alexandria.  The choice of St. Catherine suggests that this diptych was made for the private use of an aristocratic woman.

MuseumLocation.DisplayCurrentLocation: Centre Street: Third Floor: Romanesque and Gothic Art

Provenance: R. Forrer, Strassbourg, E. and M. Kofler-Truniger, Lucerne; Thomas Flannery, Winnetka, Illinois; Thomas Flannery Sale, Sotheby's, London, December 1, 1983, lot 63; Edward Lubin, New York; Max Falk, New York; Walters Art Museum, 1991, by gift.
Title: Diptych with Saint George and the Dragon, and the Virgin and Child with Saints
